poem:
**Theatre of Shadows**

In the dim theatre's hold,  
fears like whispers unfold;  
a timid heart seeks escape  
among shadows that drape—  
ghosts of imagination,  
half-seen spectres in flight.  
Yet in the play's fragile light,  
courage, like a moth,  
dances close to the flame,  
drawn by the name  
of something deeper than fright.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "How scary can theatre really be? My horror marathon in search of stage frights I am a wimp. When my friends used to gather to screech over horror movies after school, I would sit watching Countdown with one of their mums until it was over. I had to watch The Blair Witch Project with all the lights on and I never got through the opening scene of The Ring. But when it comes to horror". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
